text:
Biking beautiful Sonoma and stopping for wine Tour de Sonoma Sonoma on a Bike The Tour de Sonoma package has days of riding that could be on par with the Tour de France. The Tour de Sonoma package has days of riding that could be on par with the Tour de France. (Sonoma on a Bike) Phil Marty Chicago Tribune Biking in Sonoma comes with great refreshments. 
Sonoma on a Bike is a company that aims to satisfy travelers whose passions include biking and wine. The company's Tour de Sonoma package has days of riding that could be on par with the Tour de France. One day, for example, has 90 miles of biking, and another is 58 miles with 4,500 feet of elevation gain, all the while taking in gorgeous Sonoma County. It's also possible to do more moderate rides. Interspersed with the riding are visits to some of the region's most notable wineries, including Roth, Ferrari-Carano and Fog Crest. The six-day tour is limited to just 12 bikers and has multiple dates in 2016. The $3,400 per person double-occupancy rate covers lodging, meals, wine with meals, use of Specialized Allez Comp bikes, bike guides, van support and more. Info: 800-499-2453, www.sonomaonabike.com 
Unique vacation rentals 
Boutique Homes specializes in booking vacation rentals in unique lodgings and locations around the world. An example is a recent listing of 10 homes that are immersed in nature. Desert Gold is a three-bedroom/two-bath modernistic property that sits in Death Valley, 150 miles northwest of Las Vegas. It rents for $3,000 a week. Then there's the Modern Bohemian Cabin in Argentina's gorgeous Patagonia region. A steep mountain road leads to the house, which has just one bedroom but can sleep five. It costs $130 a night. Off-Grid House is in Pioneertown in the California desert north of North Palm Springs. There's no TV or Internet â€” just lovely desert views. It's two bedrooms and goes for $400 per night or $2,500 per week. Info: http://tinyurl.com/qfjy5bs 
Road Scholar's free airfare 
Road Scholar, whose educational trips are put together by Elderhostel, has a group of new tours that it calls Great American Get-Togethers. And it's sweetening the deal on these packages by offering free airfare if you book by a specific date. For instance, there'll be two tours in the Tetons and Yellowstone National Park next August that are priced from $1,999 per person double occupancy. Book by March 31, and you'll get free air from several cities. That tour will include a float trip down the Snake River in Grand Teton National Park, an aerial tram ride to the top of a mountain for some high-altitude hiking, canoeing and working on a service project. The package covers seven nights' lodging, most meals, 11 field trips as well as lectures and hands-on experiences. Other packages offered are in locations such as San Antonio, Santa Fe, New Mexico, and Banff, Alberta. Info: 800-454-5768, http://tinyurl.com/qahpo5u 
Phil Marty is a freelance reporter.
